title: Coat Rack, Frosta Z Coat Rack, 2012
medium: Two IKEA Frosta stools (birch plywood, hardware)
dimensions:
H x W x D: 40 x 40 x 170 cm (15 3/4 in. x 15 3/4 in. x 5 ft. 6 15/16 in.)
(Plus 2 Frosta Z's disassembled)
description: Coat rack and deconstructed IKEA parts.
gallery_text: IKEA’s famous flat-pack designs reduce the cost of assembling, shipping, and storage; the company relies on users to assemble products. IKEA hackers repurpose existing components into new designs. Andreas Bhend created this coat rack with parts from IKEA’s Frosta stool, a four-legged version of Alvar Aalto’s classic three-legged Stool 60 (1933). Bhend publishes his instructions online to encourage others to use his design and invent their own.

Courtesy of the designer. s-e-1676.
